intro: Cynanchum acuminatifolium, commonly known as the sharp-leafed milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many species known for their milky sap. The plant features slender, ascending stems covered with fine, hairy leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in umbellate clusters, and are pollinated by insects. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
